# Linen Rental and Laundering Services

## Background
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) D-Division Training Branch requires linen rental and laundering services one day a week for its barracks.

## Service Requirements
The successful bidder must provide all necessary labor, materials, equipment, shipping, supervision, personnel travel, and accommodations to fulfill the service requirements.

## Service Period
The contract period will be one year from the contract date, with a potential to extend for up to two additional one-year periods.

## Key Details
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Security:** This solicitation contains a security requirement
* **Language:** Documents may be submitted in either official language
* **Indigenous Procurement:** This procurement is conditionally set aside under the federal government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business

## Important Notes
* The RCMP retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement
* Bidders must certify their status as Indigenous Business under the PSIB
* Canada will not consider bids from non-Indigenous businesses unless less than two Indigenous businesses remain

## Contact Information
* Qyitayo Ziwa, RCMP Bid Receiving Unit:
    + Email: qyitayo.ziwa@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
    + Phone: (306) 962-5415
    + Fax: None

## Document Availability
* The tender documents are available for download from CanadaBuys: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities> and <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/occasions-de-marche>

## Registration Requirements
* Consider registering in the Indigenous Business Directory to increase visibility and compete for federal government contracts reserved for Indigenous businesses under the PSIB.

Please refer to the attached tender documents for further information. Submit your tender to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit as per page one of the Request for Proposal (RFP).

Tender Closing Date: **2023-09-05T16:00:00**.
